item.title: Pavement obstructed 06:40hrs 29/09/25 YF72MXY, 29th September
item.description:
Obstructing a pavement with a vehicle in London is against the law, as Highway Code Rule 244 prohibits pavement parking and it is considered an unnecessary obstruction of the highway under national and local legislation, including the Greater London Act 1974. Highway Code Rule 244: States that you must not park partially or wholly on the pavement in London. Greater London Act 1974: Prohibits pavement parking in London, making it a part of national law via the Traffic Management Act. Highways Act 1980: Provides powers for police and highway authorities to act against any unlawful obstruction of the highway, which includes pavements
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Willow Grove, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees blocking pavement, 29th September
item.description:
The growth of this bush/tree is obstructing the pavement forcing everyone to walk in a road. Wheelchair users and buggies and even people at times canâ€™t walk on the pavement due the vegetation over taking the pavement, forcing them to walk in the road on a blind corner. This is a serious accident waiting to happen.
